segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, ye keci pāṇā cattāro iriyāpathe kappenti—
segments.en: “Mendicants, living creatures engage in the four postures:

segments.pli: kālena gamanaṃ, kālena ṭhānaṃ, kālena nisajjaṃ, kālena seyyaṃ, sabbe te pathaviṃ nissāya pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhāya evamete cattāro iriyāpathe kappenti;
segments.en: sometimes walking, sometimes standing, sometimes sitting, sometimes lying down. They do so depending on the earth and grounded on the earth.

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlaṃ nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkaroti.
segments.en: In the same way, a mendicant develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlaṃ nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkaroti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant develop the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ … pe … upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlaṃ nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarotī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, living creatures engage in the four postures:

suttaplex.blurb: Just as living creatures are based on the earth, the awakening factors are based on ethics.
